result.execSummary:
The defendant William Terrell Gardner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony, Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to 14CF5666, with credit for 0 days time served.
Same conditions as probation, except for condition time.

miscConds.notes:
Fine is set at $0.00.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Obtain/Maintain Full Time employment as allowed by medical professionals.

No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any vehicle where a firearm is present. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at any one time.
- No possession of more than 1 cell phone or more than 1 phone number listed under the Defendants name at one time. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- No contact with any place where illegal drugs purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.

Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 72 hours of receiving prescription from any Doctor.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
Provide a DNA sample, if not already done.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.

timeConds.notes:
without good time, with release for inmate work assignment, and medical appointments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. This is STAYED to use as follows:
*First violation with illegal drugs, possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription or possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor will result in 30 days. 
*Second violation with illegal drugs, possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription or possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor will result in 45 days. 
* Third violation with illegal drugs, possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription or possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor will result in 60 days, if not revoked at this point.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Terrell Gardner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William Terrell Gardner in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, consecutive to 14CF5666, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS with the following conditions:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

- Court ordered 135 days of condition time in the House of Correction, without good time, with release for inmate work assignment, and medical appointments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. This is STAYED to use as follows:

*First violation with illegal drugs, possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription or possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor will result in 30 days. 
*Second violation with illegal drugs, possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription or possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor will result in 45 days. 
* Third violation with illegal drugs, possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription or possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor will result in 60 days, if not revoked at this point. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing. 
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 72 hours of receiving prescription from any Doctor.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at any one time.
- No possession of more than 1 cell phone or more than 1 phone number listed under the Defendants name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any vehicle where a firearm is present. 
- Obtain/Maintain Full Time employment as allowed by medical professionals.
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- No contact with any place where illegal drugs purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
- Fine is set at $0.00 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Case proceeds to Plea Hearing. 
AS TO COUNT 1 of the Amended Information- 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Case is adjourned for Sentencing on 5-26-2015 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant William Terrell Gardner in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Amended Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant wishes to plead not guilty. Defendant is charged as follows: Possession of THC (Tetrahydrocannabinols) -2nd Subsequent Offense - PTAC, As a Party to a Crime, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 961.41(3g)(e), 939.50 (3)(i) and 939.05, a Class I Felony.

Defendant William Terrell Gardner in court with attorney Robert E Webb. Patricia Daugherty on behalf of Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case ser for final pretrial and motion hearing. Defense received a new offer, and withdraws motion. Case is adjourned for plea hearing. Jury trial scheduled for 5-04-2015 is vacted.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress Fruits of an Illegal Search and State's Motion to Deny Defendant's Suppression Motion Without a Hearing received and filed. tk
Motion to Suppress Fruits of an Illegal Search filed by Defense counsel Robert E. Webb, received and filed.

Defendant William Terrell Gardner in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Scheduling Conference. State motions the Court to join with case 15CF161. Defense objects. Court withholds decision of joining the cases until the Final Pretrial Conference. 
Case is adjourned for Motion Hearing and Final Pretrial Conference on 4-23-2015 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17. Jury Trial is calendared for 5-4-2015 at 9:00 a.m., Br. 17.
Any motions are due no later than 4-10-2015 by 5:00 p.m. and any response is due no later than 4-20-2015 by 5:00 p.m.

Defendant William Terrell Gardner in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-20-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant William Terrell Gardner in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
